refnamediv.para: This page lists all the functions to get information about Scilab native objects.

refsynopsisdiv.para: Return variable called name, NULL if variable does not exist.
Get type of var. see types help page.

refsynopsisdiv.para: Return 1 if variable var has the right type.
Return 1 if variable var is complex.
Return the number of dimension of var. Note that scalar variables are 2d matrix of dimension (1, 1)
refsynopsisdiv.literal: int scilab_getDim2d(scilabEnv env, scilabVar var, int* row, int* col)
refsynopsisdiv.para: Return dimensions of a 2d variable var in row and col.
refsynopsisdiv.literal: int scilab_getDimArray(scilabEnv env, scilabVar var, const int** dims)
refsynopsisdiv.para: Return pointer on array of dimensions of a variable var in dims.
For matrix type is the result of product of dimension and for others like list is the item count.
Return 1 for empty matrix and empty list.
Return 1 for matrix with 2 dimensions and scalar.
refsynopsisdiv.literallayout: int scilab_isVector(scilabEnv env, scilabVar var) int scilab_isNVector(scilabEnv env, scilabVar var, int n) int scilab_isRowVector(scilabEnv env, scilabVar var) int scilab_isColVector(scilabEnv env, scilabVar var)
refsynopsisdiv.para: Use to check if variable var is a vector. n is the dimension to check, scilab_isRowVector is equivalente to scilab_isNVector(env, var, 1)
Return 1 for matrix with dimensions count is up to 2.

nin, in, nout, out must be used like in gateway prototype.
